verbose_text: The main aim of our study was to determine whether the TLR4 inhibitory activity of curcumin, which has been demonstrated in other pathological conditions such as liver cancer 15, traumatic brain injury 16 and atherosclerosis 17, contributed to its protective anti-inflammatory effect of curcumin on OA.
evidence: TLR4 inhibitory activity of curcumin, which has been demonstrated in other pathological conditions such as liver cancer 15 , traumatic brain injury 16  and atherosclerosis 17 , contributed to its protective anti-inflammatory effect of curcumin on OA
